item.title: Readings
item.description: Reading leaders signup sheet FURTHER READING Anny Li, How to Encounter a Puddle, 2018 Ursula K. LeGuin, Carrier Bag Theory of Fiction, 1986 Internetting with Amanda Hess, ongoing Shannon Mattern, Things that Go Beep, 2018 Alexandra Lange, The Woman Who Gave the Macintosh a Smile, 2018 Beatriz Colomina and Mark Wigley, Are We Human?: Notes on an Archaeology of Design (Introduction), 2016 Aria Dean & Martine Syms, Growing Up Google, 2017 Marjanne van Helvert, Dirty Design Margarat Anderson, In Web Design, Accessibility Shouldn’t Be an Afterthought, 2020 Silas Munro, Typography as a Radical Act, 2019 Ruben Pater, The Politics of Design, 2016 Anne Friedberg, Virtual Window, 2006 (Excerpt) Mimi Onuoha and Mother Cyborg, People’s Guide to AI, 2018 VPRO, The Real Value of Your Personal Data, 2013 video David Reinfurt, “Muriel Cooper”, 2018 video Natalie Cecire, Apple’s Modernism, Google’s Modernism, 2015 Maciej Ceglowski, Web Design: The First 100 Years, 2014 Louise Drulhe, Critical Atlas of Internet Jenny Odell, How to do Nothing, 2017 Paul Ford, Reboot the World, 2016 Siva Vaidhyanathan, Open Source as Culture/Culture as Open Source, 2005 Danah Boyd, Participating in the Always-On Lifestyle, 2015 Rem Koolhaas, Junkspace, 2002 Allessandro Ludovico, Post-Digital Print, 2012

item.title: Resources
item.description: The technologies, languages, and libraries introduced in class are well documented online. If you are having difficulties, take time to troubleshoot online before asking for help. Good coding is good online searching! Core 2 Class Lectures Vimeo pw: interaction Office hours with CD Tutors Required Communication Design visiting lecture series: Archived here Fridays, 3–4pm GETTING SETUP Setting up Your Workspace What’s the Point of Critique? Basic file structure demo Github site template Organizing and Naming Files OTHER CLASS LINKS
